operation – Alpha transformations¶

operation.base¶

class orca.operation.base.OperationBase(debug_on=True)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for alpha operations.

Note

This is a base class and should not be used directly.

__metaclass__¶

alias of ABCMeta

operate(alpha)[source]¶

Override (mandatory) to operate on alphas.

This is the sole interface of an operation class.

Parameters:alpha (DataFrame) – Alpha to be operated on
Raises:NotImplementedError
set_debug_mode(debug_on)[source]¶

Enable/Disable debug level messages in the operation. This is enabled by default.

debug(msg)[source]¶

Logs a message with level DEBUG on the operation logger.

info(msg)[source]¶

Logs a message with level INFO on the operation logger.

warning(msg)[source]¶

Logs a message with level WARNING on the operation logger.

error(msg)[source]¶

Logs a message with level ERROR on the operation logger.

critical(msg)[source]¶

Logs a message with level CRITICAL on the operation logger.

operation.neutralize¶

class orca.operation.neutralize.GroupNeutOperation(group=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.operation.base.OperationBase

Class to neutralize alpha within a group.

Parameters:group – Groupings, either a Series(static grouping) or a DataFrame(dynamic grouping); in latter case, you are advised to make the index of type DatatimeIndex. Default: None
class orca.operation.neutralize.IndustryNeutOperation(standard='SW2014', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.operation.neutralize.GroupNeutOperation

Class to neutralize alpha by industry classifications.

Parameters:standard (str) – Industry classification standard, currently only supports: (‘SW2014’, ‘ZX’). Default: ‘SW2014’

operation.decay¶

class orca.operation.decay.DecayOperation(days, dense=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.operation.base.OperationBase

Class to linearly combine current alpha with decayed alphas, usually to reduce turnover.

Parameters:
  • days (int) – How many days of decayed alphas to be included in final result
  • dense (boolean) – Whether to treat NaN as 0 in current alpha. Default: False

operation.barra¶

class orca.operation.barra.BarraOperation(model, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.operation.base.OperationBase

Base class for operations based on Barra model data.

Parameters:model (str) – Model version, currently only supports: (‘daily’, ‘short’)

Note

This is a base class and should not be used directly.

class orca.operation.barra.BarraFactorNeutOperation(model, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.operation.barra.BarraOperation

Class to neutralize alpha along some Barra factors.

operate(alpha, factors)[source]¶
Parameters:factors (str, list) – Factors to be neutralized. When it is a string, it must take value in (‘industry’, ‘style’, ‘all’)
class orca.operation.barra.BarraFactorCorrNeutOperation(model, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: orca.operation.barra.BarraOperation

Class to neutralize alpha along some Barra factors.

operate(alpha, factors)[source]¶
Parameters:factors (str, list) – Factors to be neutralized. When it is a string, it must take value in (‘industry’, ‘style’, ‘all’)

operation.api¶

orca.operation.api.format(df, value=nan)[source]¶

Format DataFrame into DatetimeIndex and full sids columns.

Parameters:value – Value to be filled for missing points
orca.operation.api.intersect(df, univ)[source]¶

Intersect DataFrame with a universe.

orca.operation.api.neutralize(df)[source]¶

Make DataFrame with mean 0 for each row.

orca.operation.api.scale(df)[source]¶

Make DataFrame with absolute sum 1 for each row.

orca.operation.api.top(df, n)[source]¶

Return top n elements for each row in DataFrame.

Returns:A boolean DataFrame with same shape as df with desired element position as True
orca.operation.api.bottom(df, n)[source]¶

Return bottom n elements for each row in DataFrame.

Returns:A boolean DataFrame with same shape as df with desired element position as True
orca.operation.api.qtop(df, q)[source]¶

Return top q-quantile elements for each row in DataFrame.

Returns:A boolean DataFrame with same shape as df with desired element position as True
orca.operation.api.qbottom(df, q)[source]¶

Return bottom q-quantile elements for each row in DataFrame.

Returns:A boolean DataFrame with same shape as df with desired element position as True
orca.operation.api.quantiles(df, n)[source]¶

Cut DataFrames into quantiles.

Returns:A list of n boolean DataFrames with same shape as df with desired element position as True, the first one being bottom quantile and last one being top quantile
